data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
Only optionally activate comment evaluation (#310)

According to the discussion in #300, comment evaluation should be an opt-in feature,
primarily because commenting is regularly used to simply disable broken code.
Obviously, in such a use case, comment evaluation would be counterproductive.

Now, comment evaluation can be enabled with a special comment:
`<!-- xacro:eval-comments -->` or `<!-- xacro:eval-comments:on -->`

It remains active for the following comments until:
- the current XML tag's scope is left (or a new tag entered)
- another tag or non-whitespace text is processed
- it becomes explicitly disabled via: `<!-- xacro:eval-comments:off -->`

Reverts 43ceb30d1b2d075514889d7e1aa00dfaf4fe4f4d, i.e. issues an error on failed expression evaluation again.

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
Fix property definition into parent scope

Setting a property within the parent scope may occur in two contexts:
1. From within a macro. In that case, one wants to set the property in the caller's scope.
2. From within the included file. In that case, one wants to set the property in the includer's scope.

This is a follow-up of #297, which resolved a corresponding issue for macro names only.
As we have separate dicts for macros and symbols, we need to resolve both of them.

Fixup scoped macro evaluation

The definition of a new scope for macro definitions (introduced in #272)

This commit also introduces a corresponding unit test.

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
Fix resolving of macros declared and called in/from a namespace (#297)

Given two macros, declared in a namespace-included file. From outside the namespace, obviously, they need to be called with the namespace prefix.
However, when calling one macro from the other (within the namespace), the prefix shouldn't be required anymore (it's not even known). To fix this issue, the "active" `macros` dictionary needs to be updated during macro resolution.

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
Allow greedy property evaluation (#284)

This can be used, to redefine a property from its previous value, e.g. for normalization:
```xml
<xacro:property name="prop" value="${prop.lower()}" lazy_eval="false"/>
```
Without this option, due to lazy evaluation, it would try to recursively evaluate the property.

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
Correctly expose xml namespaces imported via xacro:include within a macro (#287)

Namespace declarations are lifted to the parent of the include node.
In case of a macro instantiation, this is a dummy node whose contents are kept
but which is removed itself.
Hence, before removing the dummy node, we need to lift any namespace definitions.

Generalize Table()

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
Ignore underscores when parsing literal numeric values

python3, due to PEP515, allows numerical values to be (visually) grouped via underscores.
However, here, we want to consider literals containing an underscore as a string.

introduces dependencies that cannot be catched by xacro --deps.
The new argument DEPENDS allows to specify any other files required.

data.message:
improve matching test for text

- handle numeric values at arbitrary locations, e.g. "3.1415 0 1"
- ignore dict order, correctly parsing dict expressions and comparing resulting dicts

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message: more pythonic equality test

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
fixed literal parsing

Parsing of number and boolean literals was done with ast.literal_eval().
However, since python3 this function evaluates expressions like "5 -3"
as the number result and not a string anymore.
Hence resort to explicit type-casting to int, float, or boolean.

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
minor performance improvement

avoid calling lex.peek() multiple times

data.author: Kartik Mohta
data.message: Add xml.dom.minidom import

data.author: Kartik Mohta
data.message:
Small fixes to make it work with Python 3

Note that two tests fail due to internal changes in Python 3:
- test_iterable_literals_eval: The order of keys in dict changed in Py3
- test_no_evaluation: ast.literal_eval('5 -2') gives 3 in Py3

be executed within the correct catkin environment. Otherwise different
xacro versions might be used for both steps.

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
fixed evaluation order of macro arguments and body

Macro arguments need to be evaluated and assigned to properties before
body is evaluated. Otherwise, the evaluated value will be converted to
str, i.e. loosing original type.

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
improved deprecation warnings

New cli option `--xacro-ns` allows to enforce the new policy
requiring the xacro namespace prefix (and suppressing deprecation warnings).
However, non-prefixed tags will not be modified by xacro anymore
(as requested by #41, #59, #60).

Partially reverted cb73cfd8c678adfda2172accef398189ea2338a1, handling
<arg> tags in the same fashion as other tags, i.e. issue a warning if
used without prefix and ignoring it with cli argument `--xacro-ns`.

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
Merge pull request #77 from ubi-agni/jade-devel

improved xacro's cmake macros

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
prepend ${PACKAGE_NAME} to all generated cmake targets

Otherwise multiple packages employing xacro's cmake macros will use the
same conflicting target name.
This is only an issue with catkin_make, which defines a single global
cmake namespace. The new catkin tools (or catkin_make_isolated) build
each package separately.

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message: basic unittest for xacro's cmake macros

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
improved xacro's cmake macros

- xacro_add_xacro_file() automatically determines output file from input (removing .xacro suffix).
  If that fails, a fatal error is raised.
- added xacro_install() to allow installation into both, devel and install space.
- replaced conveniency function xacro_add_files()

data.author: Morgan Quigley

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
Merge pull request #76 from ubi-agni/cwd_substitution

I agree, this can be useful in some cases. Thank you for your time and contributions.

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
Merge pull request #75 from ubi-agni/recursive-include

This is great; I tested it by messing up an XML file deep in the PR2 tree and it dutifully reported the filename and line number of the failed XML syntax. As I'm sure you have already discovered, syntax errors deep within xacro trees can be really hard to track down. Thank you for your time and contributions.

data.author: Morgan Quigley

Merge pull request #74 from ubi-agni/jade-devel

Thank you for your time and contributions. More tests are always a good thing!

added --debug option to explicitly enable stack traces

By default, only show error message to the user.
Stack traces are only interesting for xacro developers.

- allows to use relative path names for include filename specs

Thank you for simplifying #65 and generating this PR; it makes the main() function much cleaner and easier to read. Cheers

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message: added missing return statement

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
removed obsolete math import

left over from deaaae2c69edd7d5e185eeb098c1521d8711608b

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
install xacro.py again (for backwards compatibility)

usage of xacro.py issues a deprecation warning

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
simplified scripts/xacro - removed xacro.py

- made run script "scripts/xacro" and install process follow standards
- removed xacro.py
- added dependencies to setup.py

Having the binaries xacro and xacro.py installed side by side causes
problems, because xacro.py is wrongly taken as the module.
This was avoided by the rather complex filtering of the sys.path.
Switched to ROS standard now, using a binary script called "xacro".

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message:
changed tests to use the whole xacro processing pipeline
utilizing the modularization of main() from previous commit

This simplifies several existing tests, especially these using files on disk.

data.message:
extended cmake macro xacro_add_xacro_file()

- handle INORDER option
- handle REMAP arguments
- create absolute input file names automatically

usage: xacro_add_xacro_file(input output INORDER REMAP ...)

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message: stripped new unit tests to essential xml snippets

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message:
merged pull request #68: eval properties assigned from <arg> tags as literals

In the following example:
<xacro:arg name="val" default="0.5"/>
<xacro:property name="val" value="$(arg val)"/>

${val} was not evaluated as a number, but as string only.
Thus numerical expressions failed with an exception.

- literal evaluation should only consider literals, but no expressions
  use ast.literal_eval()
- removed eval() from xacro:if evaluation
  back to string comparison to handle (lowercase) true and false

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
added test cases to check
- for equality expressions in <xacro:if>
- math function usage

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
python based evaluation of expressions

- replaced handle_expr with python-internal eval() call
- care has been taken to resolve variables recursively on demand (in Table.__getitem__)
- allows for evaluation of standard math functions
- other desired functions could be added in eval_self_contained
- Values in Table symbols are not stored as strings but as typed values.
  If text is required, a conversion with str() is performed.
  This is need to ensure proper evaluation of expressions. Otherwise 3*"1" would evaluate to "111".
- using __future__.division we can handle int division evaluating to float as before

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message: allow variable names for filename attribute in <xacro:include>

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
allow for ordered XML processing to avoid issues with multiply defined
properties and macros in (typically 3rd party) include files

- enable the new behaviour by passing --inorder cmdline option
- to improve code readibility and reusability, introduced functions
  process_include(node), grab_macro(elt, macros), grab_property(elt, symbols)
  containing 1:1 corresponding handling from process_includes, grab_macros, and grab_properties
- added corresponding test case test_inorder_processing()

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message: dynamic macro names using <xacro:call macro=""/>

data.author: Morgan Quigley
data.message:
Merge pull request #48 from ubi-agni/fixup_unittests

fixup unittests and handling of non-element nodes in <include>, <if>, <macro>

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message: updated pr2 gold standard to include all comments

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
allow to ignore comments in nodes_match()

New handling of non-element nodes invalidates pr2 gold standard (adding
a lot more comments). To allow validation, allow to ignore all
comments in comparison (as before).

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message: fixed handling of non-element nodes in <include>, <if>, <macro>

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
fixed writexml: text nodes were not printed when other siblings exist
-> print all text, but skip whitespace-only text nodes

data.author: Robert Haschke
data.message:
improved xml matching
- so far only element nodes (with its attributes) were considered
- now also consider TEXT, CDATA, and COMMENT nodes
- added function text_matches (normalizing consecutive whitespace to a single space)

added some new unit tests
- test_consider_non_elements:
  non-element nodes are not yet considered in <if> and <macro>

data.author: Mike O'Driscoll
data.message:
Include CATKIN_ENV params at build time.

CATKIN_ENV params are not included at build time and causes the $(find pkg)
macro to fail.

CATKIN_ENV param has been added to the COMMAND argument in process execution
makefile argument.

data.author: Robert Haschke

changed quotes to omit cmake warning

Name of maintainer is literally copied into package.cmake (in build/*/catkin_generated)
and quoted by double quotes. Hence, the maintainer name shouldn't
contain double quotes or catkin should correctly quote them for cmake...
